To solve this problem, let's start by understanding how matrices transform vectors. A matrix $\mathbf{M}$ transforms a vector into another vector as follows:

$$
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{M}\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} &= \begin{pmatrix} m_{11} & m_{12} \\ m_{21} & m_{22} \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} m_{11}x + m_{12}y \\ m_{21}x + m_{22}y \end{pmatrix}.
\end{align*}
$$
